p:
The CHIKV epidemics observed in the same three islands of the French West Indies during 2013–2015 are shown in Fig 1B, and the CHIKV and ZIKV epidemics observed in French Polynesia during 2013–2015 in Fig 1C. The a priori distributions on the reproduction ratio and reporting rates for the ZIKV epidemics in the French West Indies defining the NI, R or L approaches are shown in Fig 2. The R priors were wide, with 95% credible intervals between 0.5 and 2.5 for
R
0 , Z
and between 0 and 0.30 for ρ
Z . On the contrary, the more specific L priors on
R
0 , Z
were highly concentrated around 1.5 in Guadeloupe and 1.3 in Martinique, and ranged between 1.0 and 1.8 in Saint-Martin. Likewise, the island-specific priors on ρ
Z carried more information that their regional counterpart, peaking around 0.19 in Guadeloupe, and covering wider intervals in Martinique (0.20–0.40) and Saint-Martin (0.03–0.39).
